Buff.DisplayText: Buff Missing: The buff specified was missing!
3rd Degree Burns: On Vorpal: 85 to 195 Fire Damage every 2 seconds for 10 seconds, and adds 1-5 stacks of Vulnerability.
%b1 %i1 %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to %i1.

Aberration Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Aberrations, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.
Aberration Bane 6: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt the unnatural, dealing an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Aberrations.
Absolute Law: This weapon is infused with the ultimate power of Law. It does an additional 2 to 12 damage to non-lawful targets and can only be wielded by Lawful-aligned characters.
%b1 %i1 Absorption %v1%: Passive: %v1 %b1 Bonus to %i1 Absorption. (Absorption reduces damage from an element by a percentage, after resistance have been taken into account.)
%b1 Accuracy %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to attack rolls

Accursed Flame: Coalesce beyond the material, join us in the Flame! Hatred burns eternal! This weapon is wrapped in cursed flames, dealing an additional 6d6 Fire damage on each hit. When striking an enemy that has been Quelled, it also deals 6d6 Evil damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 6 to 15 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.

Improved Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 8 to 20 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.

Greater Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 12 to 30 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.

Superior Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 16 to 40 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.

Sovereign Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 20 to 50 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.
Acid I: On Hit: 1 to 4 Acid Damage.
Acid II: On Hit: 2 to 8 Acid Damage.
Acid III: On Hit: 3 to 12 Acid Damage.
Acid IV: On Hit: 4 to 16 Acid Damage.
Acid V: On Hit: 5 to 20 Acid Damage.

Acid Burst : This weapon is sheathed in corrosive acid, and does 1 to 6 acid damage each hit. Critical hits deal an additional 1 to 10 acid damage for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 2 to 20 for a x3 multiplier and 3 to 30 for a x4 multiplier.

Acidic Reaping: While this item is equipped, any killing blows you strike against enemies grants you 40 Acid resistance for 30 seconds. Slaying weaker opponents has a reduced chance of producing this effect.
%b1 Acid Lore %v1%: Passive: Your Acid spells gain a %v1% %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Acid: This weapon is sheathed in corrosive acid. An acid weapon deals an extra 1 to 6 points of acid damage on a successful hit.
Acidic 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 2d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acidic 3: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 3d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acidic 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 4d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acidic 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 5d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acidic 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 6d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acid Touch: This weapon gives off the faint smell of acid. An acid touch weapon deals an additional +1 acid damage on a successful hit.

Acid Vulnerability: On Hit: Applies a stack of Vulnerable (1% more damage for 3 seconds. This effect stacks up to 20 times, and loses one stack on expiration.). This effect may only occur on-hit once every second.
Action Boost Enhancement: This will increase the total number of Action Boosts you can use by 3. However, these additional Action Boosts will only take effect after the wielder rests.
Adamantine: Adamantine weapons may bypass the damage reduction of certain items and creatures.
Adamantine Lined: Adamantine weapons may bypass the damage reduction of certain items and creatures.

Air Guard: This Weapon stores the incredible, dynamic power of the air deep within. When the user of this weapon is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally comes to the surface, knocking enemies over or speeding up the wearer with rushing winds.
Alchemical Air Attunement: Attacks and offensive spells have a small chance to deal massive electric damage.
Alchemical Earth Attunement: Attacks and offensive spells deal stacking acid damage over time.
Alchemical Fire Attunement: Attacks and offensive spells have a small chance to deal massive fire damage.
Alchemical Water Attunement: Attacks and offensive spells have a chance to inflict ten stacks of cold damage over time, fading one stack at a time. This effect has an internal cooldown.

Alchemical Conservation: This item modifies the user's energy expenditure in such a way that many abilities can be used more frequently than normal. You will gain +1 Ki on every successful attack, and you will increase the number of Action Boosts, Turn Undead attempts, and Bard Songs you can use per rest by 1 each.
Aligned: This weapon transmutes into a form that is able to bypass any alignment based Damage Reduction. (Chaotic, Good, Evil, Lawful)
%b1 Alluring Skills Bonus %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Bluff, Diplomacy, Haggle, Intimidate, and Perform .

Anarchic Blast 3: This weapon is a chaotic conduit, dealing 3d6 Chaos damage on a successful hit, and an additional 3d6 Chaos damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotically aligned. Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Anarchic Blast 4: This weapon is a chaotic conduit, dealing 4d6 Chaos damage on a successful hit, and an additional 4d6 Chaos damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotically aligned. Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Anarchic Blast 6: This weapon is a chaotic conduit, dealing 6d6 Chaos damage on a successful hit, and an additional 6d6 Chaos damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotically aligned. Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Anarchic: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 2d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 2: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 2d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 3: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 3d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 4: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 4d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 5: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 5d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 6: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 6d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)
Hidden effect: Anathema: Increases all threat generated by spells by 25%.
Anchoring: This item grants its wearer immunity to effects that are time based or involve planar displacement. You are also immune to Haste and Banishment.

Animal Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Animals, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.Upgradeable - Tier 2 +2 Enhancement Bonus +2 Enhancement Bonus : +2 enhancement bonus to attack and damage rolls . -> +3 Enhancement Bonus +3 Enhancement Bonus : +3 enhancement bonus to attack and damage rolls.
Animal Bane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt the natural, dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Animals.
Animal Bane 3: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt the natural, dealing an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Animals.
Animal Bane 4: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt the natural, dealing an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Animals.
Animal Bane 5: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt the natural, dealing an additional 5d10 bane damage vs. Animals.
Animal Bane 6: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt the natural, dealing an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Animals.

Angelic Grace: When you are hit, 5% chance to gain 150 Temporary Hitpoints. This can only proc once every 10 seconds. These Temporary Hitpoints last for 10 minutes or until used up, whichever is first.
Anger: This will increase the total number of Rages you can use by 3. However, these additional Rages will only take effect after the wielder rests.

Antimagic Spike: This item was made from powerful antimagic materials. When scoring a critical hit on an enemy with your ranged or melee weapons, the target must make a DC 28 Fortitude save or be unable to cast spells for a brief duration.
Anthem: When equipped by a character with Bard levels, this item begins to hum an inspiring tune. Your bard songs regenerate slowly over time.

Antipodal: This weapon is a carefully balanced confluence of diametrically opposed planar energies. This weapon deals an extra 1d6 points of Good damage to non-Good enemies, an extra 1d6 points of Evil damage to non-Evil enemies, an extra 1d6 points of Law damage to non-Lawful enemies, and an extra 1d6 points of Chaotic damage to non-Chaotic enemies.
Arcane Augmentation I: Increases the wearer's caster level when casting first level sorcerer or wizard spells by two. (BUG APPLIES TO ALL SPELLS)
Arcane Augmentation IX: Increases the wearer's caster level when casting ninth level or lower sorcerer or wizard spells by two.
Arcane Casting Dexterity: This ability reduces the arcane spell failure chance by -10%.

Arcane Lore: All spells gain a +6% chance to critical hit. All spell critical damage is increased by adding 0.25 to the spell critical damage multiplier. This effect does not stack with other item effects or potions.
Archmagi:This item grants the wearer +200 maximum spell points . Sorcerers and Favored Souls gain up to double spell points from items.
Armor Bonus %v1: This item surrounds the wearer with an invisible but tangible field of force, granting %b1 armor bonus to AC, just as though he were wearing armor.
%v1 Enhancement Bonus: This item has been magically enhanced. Armor with this quality gains a %v1 Enhancement bonus to AC.
%b1 Armor Mastery %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to the Max Dex Bonus of your equipped light, medium, or heavy armor. This benefit does not apply to the Max Dex Bonus of a Tower Shield.
%b1 Armor-Piercing %v1%: Passive: %v1% %b1 bonus to Fortification Bypass. (Fortification Bypass makes your attacks ignore a percentage of enemy Fortification.)
%b1 Assassinate %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to the DC of character's Assassinate attempts.
%b1 Alluring Skills Bonus %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Disable Device, Repair and Search.
%b1 Attack Bonus %v1: Provides a %v1 %b1 bonus to your attack rolls.
Axeblock II: Passive: Reduces physical damage taken by 4, except from Bludgeoning or Piercing weapons. (Damage Reduction: 4/Pierce, Bludgeon)
Axeblock III: Passive: Reduces physical damage taken by 6, except from Bludgeoning or Piercing weapons. (Damage Reduction: 6/Pierce, Bludgeon)
Axeblock V: Passive: Reduces physical damage taken by 10, except from Bludgeoning or Piercing weapons. (Damage Reduction: 10/Pierce, Bludgeon)
Axeblock VI: Passive: Reduces physical damage taken by 12, except from Bludgeoning or Piercing weapons. (Damage Reduction: 12/Pierce, Bludgeon)
Axeblock X: Passive: Reduces physical damage taken by 20, except from Bludgeoning or Piercing weapons. (Damage Reduction: 20/Pierce, Bludgeon)
Axiomatic I: On Hit: 1 to 6 Law damage. Law-aligned creatures are immune to this effect.
Axiomatic II: On Hit: 2 to 8 Law damage. Law-aligned creatures are immune to this effect.
Axiomatic III: On Hit: 3 to 12 Law damage. Law-aligned creatures are immune to this effect.
Axiomatic IV: On Hit: 4 to 16 Law damage. Law-aligned creatures are immune to this effect.
Axiomatic V: On Hit: 5 to 20 Law damage. Law-aligned creatures are immune to this effect.

Axiomatic: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 1d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 2: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 2d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 3: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 3d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 4: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 4d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 5: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 5d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 6: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 6d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.
Axiomatic Blast 2: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 2d6 Law damage on a successful hit, and an additional 2d6 Law damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.
Axiomatic Blast 3: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 3d6 Law damage on a successful hit, and an additional 3d6 Law damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.
Axiomatic Blast 4: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 4d6 Law damage on a successful hit, and an additional 4d6 Law damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.
Axiomatic Blast 5: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 5d6 Law damage on a successful hit, and an additional 5d6 Law damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.
Axiomatic Blast 6: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 6d6 Law damage on a successful hit, and an additional 6d6 Law damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.

Axiomatic Burst: An axiomatic weapon is lawfully aligned and infused with the power of law. It makes the weapon law-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding damage reduction. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against all of chaotic alignment and an extra 3 to 18 on a critical for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 4 to 24 for a x3 multiplier, and 5 to 30 for a x4 multiplier.

Axiomatic Burst 2: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 2d6 Law damage on a successful hit to Chaotic enemies, and 1d6 Law damage on a critical hit to Chaotic enemies. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.

Axiomatic Burst 4: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 4d6 Law damage on a successful hit to Chaotic enemies, and 9d6 Law damage on a critical hit to Chaotic enemies. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.

Axiomatic Burst 6: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 6d6 Law damage on a successful hit to Chaotic enemies, and 1d6 Law damage on a critical hit to Chaotic enemies. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.
Bane of the Depths: Your Negative, Poison and Cold spells automatically apply the effects of Bane to enemies struck.

Banishing: On Hit: 4 to 24 Bane damage to Outsiders. On Vorpal Hit : If an outsider struck by this weapon has fewer than 1000 Hit Points, it is instantly slain. If the outsider has above 1000 Hit Points, it takes 100 damage.
Banishing Fists: On Vorpal Hit: If an outsider struck by your attacks has fewer than 1000 Hit Points, it is instantly slain. If the outsider has above 1000 hit points, it takes 100 damage.

Banishing Weapons: While wearing this item, your melee and ranged weapons gain Vorpal Effect: In addition, on an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit this weapon will banish a creature from this plan of existence. Powerful creatures may resist the vorpal effect until sufficiently wounded.
Battle-Scarred: This item has obviously seen use in many fights. It is chipped and scratched, but perhaps in the future there will be a way to restore it to its former glory.
Bewildering: Targets of this weapon can feel their willpower slipping away. They lose -1 Wisdom on a successful attack.
Blackscale Ferocity: Killing enemies may cause you to fall into a ferocious rage, granting you the benefits of the Haste spell.
Blazing: This weapon is sheathed in fierce flame. A blazing weapon deals an extra 2 to 12 points of fire damage on a successful hit.
Blazing 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 5d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 6d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 7: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 7d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 8: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 8d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 9: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 9d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 10: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 10d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 11: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 11d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 12: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 12d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 13: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 13d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 14: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 14d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 15: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 15d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Bleed: This weapon is cruelly sharp and will do an additional 1 to 8 damage to targets that are vulnerable to bleeding.
Bleeding 2: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 2d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bleeding 3: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 3d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bleeding 4: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 4d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bleeding 5: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 5d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bleeding 6: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 6d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bless Ward: You are warded against the Bless spell.
%b1 Blighted Lore %v1: Passive: Your Acid, Negative, Poison and Evil spells gain a %v1 %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Blindness Immunity: Grants its wearer immunity to blindness effects.

Blood: This Docent converts a portion of the wood and metal structure of the Warforged to living flesh. The Warforged will benefit more from positive energy healing such as cure spells and potions (+20 Positive Healing Amplification) but will also be more subject to critical hits (-10% fortification ).

Bloodletter II: On Critical Hit: 5 to 30 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 5 to 40 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 5 to 50 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter III: On Critical Hit: 7 to 42 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 7 to 56 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 7 to 70 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter IV: On Critical Hit: 9 to 54 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 9 to 72 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 9 to 90 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter V: On Critical Hit: 11 to 66 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 11 to 88 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 11 to 110 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter VI: On Critical Hit: 13 to 78 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 13 to 104 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 13 to 130 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.
Bloodrage Defense: When you are holding a two-handed weapon, you gain a +10 Profane bonus to Physical and Magical Resistance Rating.

Bloodletter VII: On Critical Hit: 15 to 90 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 15 to 120 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 15 to 150 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.
Bloody Thorns: This powerful item is a dangerous weapon to those well-versed in Nature. You receive a Primal bonus to Damage for every four of your Wilderness Lore feats.
Bludgeoning 2: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 2d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Bludgeoning 3: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 3d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Bludgeoning 4: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 4d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Bludgeoning 5: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 5d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Bludgeoning 6: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 6d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Blunted Ammunition: The ammunition fired by this weapon deals blunt damage in addition to its other damage types.
Blunt Trauma: This weapon is incredibly dense and delivers especially powerful blows. When rolling a 19 or 20 on a melee attack, your critical multiplier is increased by +1.
Blurry: Equipping this item causes you to become slightly blurry. Attacks from enemies have a 20% chance to miss you due to concealment.
Bodyfeeder: Whenever a bodyfeeder weapon you wield scores a critical hit, you gain 15 temporary hit points that last for up to 1 minute.
Boon of Undeath: Undead take solace in the hate of others. Every time a character wearing a Boon of Undeath item is struck in combat, an Inflict Light Wounds spell will be cast on the character.
Bone Paws: While in any Wild Shape, your weapons gain Piercing damage bypass and +1[W].

Bonesplitter: This weapon is powerful enough to shatter the bones of those it strikes. On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit, the weapon breaks multiple bones in the target's body, causing significant impairment. Creatures with skeletons take 40d6 damage and will have their movement and attacks slowed by 25% and their attack damage reduced by 25% when their bones are shattered.
Breath Weapon Focus +%v1 : +%v1 Equipment bonus to the DC of Breath Weapon spells.

Brilliance: This weapon glows with the Light of Irian. This weapon deals an extra 1 to 6 points of Light damage on a successful hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 1 to 10 Light damage for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 2 to 20 for a x3 critical multiplier and 3 to 30 for a x4 multiplier.
Brilliant Silver Scales: This helmet is fashioned from brilliant silver Dragonscale, and is warded against the cold. +%v1 Enhancement bonus to Resist Cold.
Brazen Brilliance: With this item equipped, your offensive attacks and spells have a chance of creating a burst of pure light, dealing Light damage and blinding enemies.
Byeshk: Byeshk is effective against Mind Flayers and other aberrations.
Cacophony: This weapon stores the power of a hundred blasts of sound within. Occasionally, this resonating power comes to the surface, devastating enemies with massive sonic damage.

Cacophonic Guard: This weapon stores the power of a hundred blasts of sound within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this resonating power occasionally comes to the surface, devastating enemies with massive sonic damage.
Calamitous Blows: When you are holding a two-handed weapon, you gain a +3% Profane bonus to doublestrike.

Cannith Combat Infusion: Your ranged and melee attacks have a chance to cause this item to inject a Cannith Combat Infusion into your bloodstream. For the next ten seconds, this will grant a +4 Alchemical bonus to Strength, Constitution and Dexterity, as well as a 5% Alchemical bonus to your chance to doublestrike and a +2 Alchemical bonus to Armor Class.
Cerulean Wave: This powerful magical implement hums in your hands and resonates with icy magic. Spells you cast have a chance of freezing your targets in a block of solid ice. DC: 35
Chaosguard: The bearer of this item gains +2 Deflection bonus to AC and +2 Resistance bonus to saving throws from Chaotic Enemies.

Chaotic Curse: The curse on this item is so powerful it can be transferred to any creature that dares touch the wearer. The rents in the fabric of the underlying cloth has made the curse unstable and it can reverse itself. Note especially that while the wearer is partially shielded he is not entirely immune to this effect.
Chilling 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 2d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chilling 3: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 3d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chilling 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 4d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chilling 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 5d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chilling 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 6d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chimera's Vitality : This item grants extra bonuses if the wearer has been bestowed with Dragonmarks. You gain +1 use of Greater Dragonmark and +5 Quality PRR per Dragonmark you have.
Cloudburst: On Vorpal, this weapon triggers a Cloudburst, striking its target with lightning and dealing sonic damage to surrounding enemies through a powerful thunderclap.
Cold Iron: This iron mined deep underground, known for its effectiveness against Fey creatures, is forged at a lower temperature to preserve its delicate properties.
Cold Touch: The temperature around this weapon is colder than normal. A cold touch weapon deals an additional +1 cold damage on a successful hit.
%b1 Combat Mastery %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to the DC to resist the character's Trip, Improved Trip, Sunder, Improved Sunder, Stunning Blow, and Stunning Fist attempts.
%b1 Combustion %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Fire spell power.
Command %v1: Passive: %v1 Insightful bonus on Charisma based skill checks. Command armor and command shields make their owners very noticeable, imposing a %v2 penalty on Hide checks.
Command: Passive: +2 Competence bonus on Charisma based skill checks. Command armor and command shields make their owners very noticeable, imposing a -6 penalty on Hide checks.
Conflagrating: This weapon is sheathed in furious flame. A conflagrating weapon deals an extra 3 to 18 points of fire damage on a successful hit.
Constricting Nightmare: Enemies struck by this weapon are stricken with a horrible fear of death, reducing their Physical Resistance and Magical Resistance by 10.

Construct Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Constructs, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.
Construct Bane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 3: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 4: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 5: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 5d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 6: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.

Construct Fortification (10%): This docent produces a a magical force that protects vital areas of the wearer more effectively. When a critical hit or sneak attack is scored on the wearer, there is a +10% chance that the critical hit or sneak attack is negated and damage is instead rolled normally. This ability is considered as Insight bonus when determining stacking with other sources of fortification.
Coronach: While wearing this item, your melee and ranged weapons gain Critical Hit Effect: Critical hit with this weapon will fascinate an undead opponent. (Will DC: 20 Negates)
%b1 Corrosion %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Acid spell power.

Corrosive Salt: This weapon stores a caustic, insatiable power deep within. When this weapon is used, this power can come to the surface in the form of a noxious, corrosive salt that dissolves all substances.
Coruscating: This weapon shines with an inner light. A coruscating weapon deals an extra 2 to 12 points of light damage on a successful hit.
Coruscating 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 2d6 Light damage on each hit.
Coruscating 3: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 3d6 Light damage on each hit.
Coruscating 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 4d6 Light damage on each hit.
Coruscating 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 5d6 Light damage on each hit.
Coruscating 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 6d6 Light damage on each hit.
Coruscating 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 6d6 Light damage on each hit.
%b1 Creeping Dust Lore %v1: Passive: Your Cold and Acid spells gain a %v1 %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Crippling: A crippling weapon is infused with binding power so that when a target is critically hit their movement is slowed by half. (Bug: Actually only a 25% decrease)
Crippling Flames: On Hit: 5% chance to apply 2 Negative Levels. On Critical: 135 to 325 Fire Damage.
Critical Befouling 1: This deadly weapon saps the charm from your enemies, dealing 1 Charisma damage on each critical hit.
Critical Befouling 2: This deadly weapon saps the charm from your enemies, dealing 2 Charisma damage on each critical hit.
Critical Befouling 3: This deadly weapon saps the charm from your enemies, dealing 3 Charisma damage on each critical hit.
Critical Wounding 2: This deadly weapon saps the health from your enemies, dealing 2 Constitution damage on each critical hit.
Critical Wounding 3: This deadly weapon saps the health from your enemies, dealing 3 Constitution damage on each critical hit.
Crown of Summer: You permanently benefit from Crown of Summer.
Crown of Summer: You have a +15 Positive Healing Amplification, and you gain 10 Melee Power and 5 Ranged Power (all enhancement bonus ).
Crushing 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 4d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 5d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 6d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 7: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 7d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 8: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 8d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 9: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 9d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 10: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 10d6 force damage on each critical hit.

Crushing 12: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 12d6 force damage on each critical hit.

Crushing 14: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 14d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 15: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 15d6 force damage on each critical hit.

Crushing Wave: This weapon stores the unstoppable force of the ocean's fury deep within. When this weapon is used, this power occasionally comes to the surface, crushing enemies beneath a torrent of frigid water.

Crystal: Crystal weapons are able to overcome the protective damage reduction of many Quori creatures, which can be resistant to other weapons. Spell failure chances for armors and shields made from crystal are also decreased by 10%.
Cursed Level Drain: Each time the player equipping this item is hit there is a small chance it will drain 1 level (no save, almost nothing wards).
Cursed Maelstrom: This weapon is wracked with a dangerous and volatile curse. Striking an enemy has a chance to place a random, debilitating, and deadly debuff on your foe.
Curse of Clumsiness: Passive -1 Penalty to Dexterity. (The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.)
Curse of Dullness: Passive -1 Penalty to Intelligence. The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.
Curse of Foolishness: Passive -1 Penalty to Wisdom. The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.
Curse of Repulsiveness: Passive -1 Penalty to Charisma. The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.
Curse of Weakness: Passive -1 Penalty to Strength. The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.
%b1 Curse Resistance %b1: Passive: %b1 Enhancement bonus to saves versus curses.
%b1 Damage Bonus %v1: Provides a %v1 %b1 bonus to damage.

Dampened: This item has been in a wet environment for too long and its original power has been weakened. Combine it with a Token of Vulkoor at the Altar of Vulkoor in the Red Fens to restore it back to its former glory.
%b1 Dark Restoration Lore %v1%: Passive: Your Negative, Poison and Positive spells gain a %v1% %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
%b1 Deadly %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to weapon damage.
Deathblock: The wearer of this item is immune to all death spells and magical death effects.
Deathblock II: Passive: 6% Enhancement Bonus to Negative Energy Absorption . In addition, you are immune to magical effects that can cause instant death.
Deathblock III: Passive: 9% Enhancement Bonus to Negative Energy Absorption . In addition, you are immune to magical effects that can cause instant death.
Deathblock IV: Passive: 12% Enhancement Bonus to Negative Energy Absorption . In addition, you are immune to magical effects that can cause instant death.
Deathblock V: Passive: 15% Enhancement Bonus to Negative Energy Absorption . In addition, you are immune to magical effects that can cause instant death.
Deathblock VI: Passive: 18% Enhancement Bonus to Negative Energy Absorption . In addition, you are immune to magical effects that can cause instant death.
Deathblock VII: Passive: 21% Enhancement Bonus to Negative Energy Absorption . In addition, you are immune to magical effects that can cause instant death.
Deathblock VIII: Passive: 24% Enhancement Bonus to Negative Energy Absorption . In addition, you are immune to magical effects that can cause instant death.
Deathblock IX: Passive: 27% Enhancement Bonus to Negative Energy Absorption . In addition, you are immune to magical effects that can cause instant death.
%b1 Deception %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to hit and %v2 Damage for Sneak Attacks.

Deception: This weapon is hard to focus upon and thus provides a +3 Enhancement bonus to Bluff checks. In addition, Deception weapons have a small chance to envelop the target in darkness, making them vulnerable to sneak attacks for a short time.

Demon Fever: This weapon is infected with a night hag's Demon Fever disease. On critical hits it will transfer the disease to enemies, dealing 1d8 Constitution damage. A successful Fortitude save (DC 22) negates this effect.
Demonic Curse: Each time you are hit in melee combat there is a chance that your attacker will be Cursed.
Demonic Might: This item gives the wearer the power of a demon, granting a +2 Profane bonus to Strength.
Demonic Retribution: Each time you are hit in melee combat there is a chance that a demonic force will strike back at your attacker hitting them with an Inflict Moderate Wounds spell.
Demonic Shield: Each time you are hit in melee combat there is a chance that a shield of demonic energy will grant you a +30 Profane bonus to temporary hit points.

Destruction: On Hit: Your target gains a stack of Armor Destruction. (-1 penalty to Armor Class, -1% of its Fortification. 20 Second Duration. Stacks up to 15 times.) This effect may trigger once every three seconds.
%b1 Devotion %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Positive (Healing) spell power.
Diehard: If you are incapacitated while this item is equipped, it will automatically stabilize you as if you had the Diehard feat.

Disease - Unholy Tear: This weapon saps the vitality from your enemies, dealing 6d6 Evil damage on each hit. It also has a chance to spread its disease whenever you strike an enemy, which will reduce their Armor Class and Positive Healing Amplification.
Disintegration: This weapon has a dark, insidious power deep within. Occasionally, this power lashes out violently at enemies and attempts to disintegrate them.

Disintegration Guard: This item has a store of dark, insidious power deep within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally lashes out violently at enemies and attempts to disintegrate them.

Disruption: On Hit: 4 to 24 Bane damage to Undead. On Vorpal Hit: If an undead struck by this weapon has fewer than 1000 Hit Points, it is instantly slain. If the undead has above 1000 Hit Points, it takes 100 damage.
%b1 Distant Diversion %v1%: %v1% %b1 bonus to decreased threat generated from ranged damage.
%b1 Diversion %v1%: %v1% %b1 bonus to decreased threat generated from melee damage.
%b1 Dodge %v1%: %v1 %b1 bonus to Dodge.
Don't Count Me Out!: You gain a +400 Enhancement Bonus to Unconsciousness Range.
%b1 Doubleshot %v1%: Passive: %v1% %b1 bonus to Doubleshot. Doubleshot is a chance to score an additional hit with a ranged attack.
%b1 Doublestrike %v1%: Passive: %v1% %b1 bonus to Doublestrike. Doublestrike is a chance to score an additional hit with a melee attack.
DR Damage Reduction 1/-: Reduces all physical damage by 1.
DR Damage Reduction 2/-: Reduces all physical damage by 2.
DR Damage Reduction 3/-: Reduces all physical damage by 3.
DR Damage Reduction 5/-: Reduces all physical damage by 5.
DR Damage Reduction 15/-: Reduces all physical damage by 15.

DR Damage Reduction 15/Adamantine: Reduces physical damage by 15, except from Adamantine attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 30/Adamantine: Reduces physical damage by 30, except from Adamantine attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 15/Bludgeoning: Reduces physical damage by 3, except from Bludgeoning attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 1/Chaotic: Reduces physical damage by 1, except from Chaotic attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 2/Chaotic: Reduces physical damage by 2, except from Chaotic attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 3/Chaotic: Reduces physical damage by 3, except from Chaotic attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 13/Chaotic: Reduces physical damage by 13, except from Chaotic attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 30/Chaotic: Reduces physical damage by 30, except from Chaotic attacks.

DR Damage Reduction 10/Evil: Reduces physical damage by 10, except from Evil attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 15/Evil: Reduces physical damage by 15, except from Evil attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 50/Evil: Reduces physical damage by 50, except from Evil attacks.

DR Damage Reduction 10/Good: Reduces physical damage by 10, except from Good attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 15/Good: Reduces physical damage by 15, except from Good attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 15/Good: Reduces physical damage by 30, except from Good attacks.

DR Damage Reduction 5/Lawful: Reduces physical damage by 5, except from Lawful attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 10/Lawful: Reduces physical damage by 10, except from Lawful attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 15/Lawful: Reduces physical damage by 15, except from Lawful attacks.
DR Damage Reduction 30/Lawful: Reduces physical damage by 30, except from Lawful attacks.

Dragon Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Dragons, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.
Dragon Bane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt those with draconic blood, dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Dragons.
Dragon Bane 3: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt those with draconic blood, dealing an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Dragons.
Dragon Bane 4: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt those with draconic blood, dealing an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Dragons.

Dragontouched: This mythical material was created by combining an unknown metal with ancient enchantments known only by the dragons. This material is said to enchant the wielder as if they were protected by +5 armor enchantment. Additionally it provides leather items with additional flexibility and metal armors additional protection.

Dragonshard Focus - Sentinel :This effect bestows additional benefits to those that bear the Dragonmark of Sentinel. Least: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Bastard Sword. Lesser: Parrying I Greater: Insightful Fortification +25%

Dream Vision %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls. Your melee and ranged attacks are also able to bypass the miss chance for attacking Incorporeal enemies as if they had Ghost Touch.
Dripping with Magma: This Obsidian weapon drips with magma on every swing. Your attacks have a high chance to deal very strong fire damage over time.
Dusk: Equipping this item engulfs you in twilight shadows. Attacks from enemies have a 10% chance to miss you due to concealment.

Earthgrab Guard: This item stores the implacable strength of the earth deep within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally comes to the surface, calling on the earth to erupt from the ground and hold an enemy in place.
Earthen Guard : When you are successfully attacked, there is a chance that a Stone Skin will be cast on you.

Echoes of Angdrelve 4: Eager to taste the flesh of your enemies, this wicked sword drips burning acid at your command. Each strike from this devastating weapon deals an additional 4d6 Acid damage on each hit.

Echoes of Angdrelve 6: Eager to taste the flesh of your enemies, this wicked sword drips burning acid at your command. Each strike from this devastating weapon deals an additional 6d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Efficient Metamagic - Embolden II: The additional spell point cost for using the Embolden Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Empower II: The additional spell point cost for using the Empower Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Empower Healing I: The additional spell point cost for using the Empower Healing Metamagic feat is reduced by 1 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Empower Healing II: The additional spell point cost for using the Empower Healing Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Enlarge II: The additional spell point cost for using the Enlarge Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Extend I: The additional spell point cost for using the Extend Metamagic feat is reduced by 1 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Extend II: The additional spell point cost for using the Extend Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Intensify II: The additional spell point cost for using the Intensify Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Maximize I: The additional spell point cost for using the Maximize Metamagic feat is reduced by 1 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Maximize II: The additional spell point cost for using the Maximize Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.

Elasticity: This bow is strung with special fibers that cause it to occasionally launch arrows with shocking force. When rolling a 19 or 20 on a ranged attack, your critical multiplier is increased by +1.
Eldritch II: On Hit: 2 to 8 Force Damage.
Eldritch III: On Hit: 3 to 12 Force Damage.
Eldritch IV: On Hit: 4 to 16 Force Damage.
Eldritch VI: On Hit: 6 to 24 Force Damage.
Electrifying: This weapon is sheathed in sparking electricity. An electrifying weapon deals an extra 3 to 18 points of electricity damage on a successful hit.
Electrifying 1: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 1d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 2d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 3: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 3d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 4d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 5d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 6d6 Lightning damage on each hit.

Electric Vulnerability: On Hit: Applies a stack of Vulnerable (1% more damage for 3 seconds. This effect stacks up to 20 times, and loses one stack on expiration.). This effect may only occur on-hit once every second.
Elemental Manipulation: This item provides a +90 Equipment bonus to your Acid, Cold, Electric, and Fire Spell Power.

%b1 Elemental Absorption +%v1%: Passive: %v1% Enhancement Bonus to Acid, Cold, Fire, and Electrical Absorption. (Absorption reduces damage from an element by a percentage, after resistance have been taken into account.)
%b1 Elemental Resistance %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to your Acid, Cold, Electricity, Fire, and Sonic Resistances.

Elemental Spell Power: Harnessing a small amount of the power and potential of the raw elements, this item gives you a +50 bonus to your maximum spell points. This stacks with all other bonuses except Elemental Spell Power.

Elf Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Elves, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.
Embodiment of Law : Chaotic aligned characters equipping this item suffer a temporary negative level until the item is removed.
Enchantable: Adventuring Bonus: This hat can be enchanted to bestow one of various benefits useful in general adventuring. Adventuring effects may change the minimum level of this item.
Enchantable: Crystal Rush: This hat can be enchanted to bestow one of various benefits to nearby kobolds in Crystal Cove.

Enchantable: Skilled Seaman: This hat can be enchanted to grant a bonus to one skill. You can have one skill bonus on a hat at a time, but can replace it with a different choice. Skill effects may change the minimum level of this item.
%b1 Enchantment Save %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to your saves versus enchantments
%i1 Energy Absorption %v1%: This effect absorbs %v1% of all %i1 damage the character would have taken, after all other protections have been penetrated.
%b1 %i1 Resistance %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to your %i1 Resistance.
Enfeebling: Critical hits by this weapon deal an extra 1 to 6 points of Strength damage.

Enhanced Bloodrage: This weapon is enhanced by blood - your blood! Each time you take damage or kill an enemy, there is a small chance that you will fall into an unholy bloodrage, greatly increasing your Melee Power, Constitution, and Damage. However, this rage will leave you more vulnerable to Physical attacks, slightly reducing your Armor Class.

Stance.Name: Enhanced Bloodrage
Stance.Description:
THIRST FOR BLOOD You spell blood... Blood! BLOOD BLOOD BLOOD! GIVE ME BLOOD!
+10 Melee Power +8 Constitution +5 Damage -4 Armor Class

Buff.DisplayText: Enhanced Ghostly: Equipping this item causes you to become partially incorporeal. Your melee attacks do not roll a miss chance for Incorporeal targets. Enemy attacks have a 15% chance to miss you due to incorporeality . You receive a +5 enhancement bonus to your Hide and Move Silently skills.
Enhanced Ki %v1: Increases the rate at which the user gains Ki with each successful attack.

Entangling Yarn: Enemies struck by this weapon have a small chance to be tangled up in its enchanted yarn, becoming Entangled and preventing all movement for 9 seconds. A DC 35 Reflex Save negates this effect.
Entropic: An entropic weapon crackles with a sinister energy that seeks to unmake anything it contacts. When it strikes a target, they take an extra 2 to 12 points of untyped damage.
Entropic 2: This weapon is intensely powerful, and crackles with destructive, unpredictable magic. It deals an additional 2d6 untyped damage on each hit.
Entropic 3: This weapon is intensely powerful, and crackles with destructive, unpredictable magic. It deals an additional 3d6 untyped damage on each hit.
Entropic 4: This weapon is intensely powerful, and crackles with destructive, unpredictable magic. It deals an additional 4d6 untyped damage on each hit.
Entropic 6: This weapon is intensely powerful, and crackles with destructive, unpredictable magic. It deals an additional 6d6 untyped damage on each hit.

Epic Freezing Ice: On items: While you are wearing this item, your melee, ranged, and unarmed attacks gain the Freezing Ice ability. (When the weapon is used, an icy power occasionally comes to the surface, attempting to freeze an enemy solid and encase them in ice.) - (duration: 9 seconds)
Epic Paragon Evil Guard: When hit or missed in combat, the attacking creature takes 8d8 Evil damage.
Epic Paragon Good Guard: When hit or missed in combat, the attacking creature takes 8d8 Good damage.
Epic Paragon Light Guard: When hit or missed in combat, the attacking creature takes 8d8 Light damage.
Equipped Healing Amplification +%v1: This effect amplifies all incoming positive energy healing by +%v1 (Equipment bonus). Includes spells, potions, and other effects.

Eternal Holy Burst: While you are wearing this item, your melee, ranged, and unarmed attacks gain the Holy Burst ability. (This weapon is holy. The weapon deals an additional 1 to 6 good damage each hit. Critical hits deal an additional 1 to 10 good damage for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 2 to 20 for a x3 multiplier and 3 to 30 for a x4 multiplier.)

Eternal Faith: An item with this quality assists only wearers who have the ability to turn undead. Eternal Faith increase the owner's effective level for the turning check by +2, his maximum Hit Dice turned by +2, and his total Hit Dice turned by +4.
Ethereal: Equipping this item causes your hands and weapons to become partially incorporeal. Your melee attacks do not roll a miss chance for Incorporeal targets.

Everbright: Flecks of marble and pearl shimmer across this shield, set within images of bursting stars and beaming suns. An everbright shield will never take damage from rust or acid and can emit a Blinding Flash 3/rest.

Evil Blast 4: This weapon is a sinister implement of evil deeds, dealing 4d6 Evil damage on a successful hit, and an additional 4d6 Evil damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Evil Blast 6: This weapon is a sinister implement of evil deeds, dealing 6d6 Evil damage on a successful hit, and an additional 6d6 Evil damage on a critical hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.
Evil characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.
Evil Outsider Bane: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 1d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Evil Outsider Bane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Evil Outsider Bane 3: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Evil Outsider Bane 4: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Evil Outsider Bane 5: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 5d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Evil Outsider Bane 6: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Exceptional Prudent Skills Bonus +%v1: +%v1 Exceptional bonus to Heal, Listen and Spot.
Extra damage vs Giants: This weapon deals an additional 2 to 16 damage against Giants.
Extra damage vs non-Giants: This weapon deals an additional 1 to 8 damage against non-Giants.
Extra Lay on Hands %v1: You have %v1 Lay on Hands charges.
Extra Smite: You have one additional Smite Evil use per rest. You must rest to gain your initial charge.
Extra Smites %v1: %v1 Smite Evil uses per rest. Smite Evil uses regenerate 15% faster.
%b1 False Life %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to hit points.
Favored Weapon: This weapon has a divine attunement and gains bonuses as if it were a Favored Weapon regardless of your Deity.
Fearsome: This item causes those who strike the user to be overcome with terror, as from the Fear spell.

Feather Falling: This item is engraved with feathers and bestows a powerful magical effect. Whenever the wearer begins to fall from any height, this effect slows the descent dramatically, causing the wearer to fall like a feather.
Feat - Bow Strength: While equipped this item grants the feat Bow Strength, allowing you to apply your Strength bonus to ranged attacks made with bows.

Feat - Mobility: While equipped this armor grants the wielder the Mobility feat: increases the maximum dexterity bonus permitted by armor and tower shields by 2, adds a +4 bonus to Armor Class while tumbling, and gain a 2% dodge bonus.
Feat - Precise Shot: While equipped this item grants the feat Precise Shot, allowing your ranged attacks to pass through other characters and monsters to strike your target.
Feat - Weapon Focus - Thrown: While equipped this item grants the feat Weapon Focus: Thrown.
Feat - Wind through the Trees: While equipped, this item grants the feat Wind through the Trees.
Feat: Quick Draw: While equipped, this item grants the feat Quick Draw.
Feeding 10: On Vorpal Hit : Your target incurs one Negative Level, and you gain +10 Temporary Hit Points. (These Temporary Hit Points last for one minute, or until used to negate incoming damage.)
Feeding 20: On Vorpal Hit : Your target incurs one Negative Level, and you gain +20 Temporary Hit Points. (These Temporary Hit Points last for one minute, or until used to negate incoming damage.)
Feeding 30: On Vorpal Hit : Your target incurs one Negative Level, and you gain +30 Temporary Hit Points. (These Temporary Hit Points last for one minute, or until used to negate incoming damage.)
Felling the Oak: On a natural 20 that is confirmed as a critical hit, this weapon will trip your opponent, forcing them to fall prone. There is no save against this effect.
Fetters of Unreality: This weapon is cruel and deadly, and leaves behind wounds that affect both the body and the soul. This weapon has a chance to inflict multiple stacks of Vulnerable.
Feybane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt those born of the Feywild, dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Fey.
Feybane 6: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt those born of the Feywild, dealing an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Fey.

Fiery Detonation: This weapon is imbued with a fiery wrath. On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit this burning power will be released, dealing damage to the target and all enemies near it for 15d6 fire damage.A successful Fortitude save (DC 39) reduces this by half.
Fiery: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to burn with enchanted flames, dealing 1d6 Fire damage on each hit.
Fiery 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to burn with enchanted flames, dealing 2d6 Fire damage on each hit.
Fiery 3: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to burn with enchanted flames, dealing 3d6 Fire damage on each hit.
Fiery 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to burn with enchanted flames, dealing 4d6 Fire damage on each hit.
Fiery 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to burn with enchanted flames, dealing 5d6 Fire damage on each hit.
Fiery 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to burn with enchanted flames, dealing 6d6 Fire damage on each hit.

Finesse: This weapon has a small Air Elemental bound to it. The wielder can use a finesse weapon as if they had the Weapon Finesse feat. In addition, the weapon grants a +2 enhancement bonus to the wielder's Dexterity score.
Fire Guard I: When Hit in Melee: Deals 1 to 4 Fire damage to your attacker.
Fire Guard II: When Hit in Melee: Deals 2 to 8 Fire damage to your attacker.
Fire Guard II: When Hit in Melee: Deals 8 to 32 Fire damage to your attacker.
Fire Guard X: When Hit in Melee: Deals 10 to 40 Fire damage to your attacker.
%b1 Fire Lore %v1: Passive: Your Fire spells gain a %v1 %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.

Fire Shield (Cold): When you are successfully attacked, there is a 10% chance that a Fire Shield (Cold) will be cast on you. If this effect activates while you have an active Fire Shield (Hot) from another item source, they will nullify each-other.
Firestorm Lore +%v1%: Passive: Your Fire and Lightning spells gain a %v1%% Equipment bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Fire Touch: This weapon gives off a faint aura of warmth. A fire touch weapon deals an additional +1 Fire damage on a successful hit.

Fire Vulnerability: On Hit: Applies a stack of Vulnerable (1% more damage for 3 seconds. This effect stacks up to 20 times, and loses one stack on expiration.). This effect may only occur on-hit once every second.
Flameblade: This blade is made of pure fire and is surprisingly light to the touch. It bypasses the Incorporeal chances of Ethereal monsters innately.
Flaming I: On Hit: 1 to 4 Fire Damage.
Flaming II: On Hit: 2 to 8 Fire Damage.
Flaming III: On Hit: 3 to 12 Fire Damage.
Flaming IV: On Hit: 4 to 16 Fire Damage.
Flaming V: On Hit: 5 to 20 Fire Damage.
Flaming VI: On Hit: 6 to 24 Fire Damage.
Flaming : This weapon is sheathed in fire. A flaming weapon deals an extra 1 to 6 points of fire damage on a successful hit.
Flaming Blast II: This weapon burns with deadly magical fire. The weapon deals an extra 2d6 Fire damage each hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 2d6 Fire damage.
Flaming Blast III: This weapon burns with deadly magical fire. The weapon deals an extra 3d6 Fire damage each hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 3d6 Fire damage.
Flaming Blast IV: This weapon burns with deadly magical fire. The weapon deals an extra 4d6 Fire damage each hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 4d6 Fire damage.
Flaming Blast V: This weapon burns with deadly magical fire. The weapon deals an extra 5d6 Fire damage each hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 5d6 Fire damage.
Flaming Blast VI: This weapon burns with deadly magical fire. The weapon deals an extra 6d6 Fire damage each hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 6d6 Fire damage.

Flaming Burst: This weapon is sheathed in fire, and deals 1 to 6 fire damage each hit. Critical hits deal an additional 1 to 10 fire damage for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 2 to 20 for a x3 multiplier and 3 to 30 for a x4 multiplier.
Flametouched Iron: Flametouched Iron grants +1 saves versus Evil Outsiders.
Fleshmaker: Magical insight into the ways of the flesh allow the wearer of this item to receive more effect from healing spells cast on them. +20 Enhancement bonus to Positive Healing Amplification.
Force: This weapon is humming with magical force. It deals an additional 1 to 6 force damage on a successful hit.
Force Blast 2: This weapon ripples with intense force, dealing 2d6 Force damage on a successful hit, and an additional 2d6 Force damage on a critical hit.
Force Blast 3: This weapon ripples with intense force, dealing 3d6 Force damage on a successful hit, and an additional 3d6 Force damage on a critical hit.
Force Blast 4: This weapon ripples with intense force, dealing 4d6 Force damage on a successful hit, and an additional 4d6 Force damage on a critical hit.
Force Blast 6: This weapon ripples with intense force, dealing 6d6 Force damage on a successful hit, and an additional 6d6 Force damage on a critical hit.
Forged Lightning: On Hit: 2% Chance to do 300 to 500 damage in a blast radius.
%b1 Fortification %v1%: %v1 %b1 bonus to reduced chance of taking critical damage on a critical hit.

Jolting 15: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 15d6 Lightning damage on each critical hit.
Keen: The base critical threat range of this weapon is doubled. This does not stack with Improved Critical feat. Vorpal Strikes by this weapon also bypass all Fortification.
%b1 Kinetic Lore %v1%: Passive: Your Force, Physical and Untyped spells gain a %v1% %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Knee Cracker: On Hit: 15% chance to slow 25% (No Save) for 5 seconds (non-bosses only).
Kos-zik, The Air-Change: +20 Insight Bonus to Jump and Tumble, +5 Insight Bonus to Sneak Attack dice and damage

Legendary Air Guard: This weapon stores the incredible, dynamic power of the air deep within. When the user of this weapon is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally comes to the surface, knocking enemies over or speeding up the wearer with rushing winds.

Legendary Blinding Embers: This weapon sheds tiny embers that can impair a creatures sight. If you roll a 20 when attacking and confirm the critical hit, the target will become blinded by a burst of fiery sparks.
Legendary Brilliance Guard: This item is imbued with a brilliant, radiant power. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, the attacker has a chance of becoming blinded.

Legendary Cursespewing : On Vorpal Hit : Your enemy is cursed with a -4 morale penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks . This painful curse also causes the victim to take 6d6+6 damage every two seconds for a duration of twelve seconds. Additional vorpal strikes while the curse is active will extend the duration by another twelve seconds.
Legendary Demon Fever : This deadly weapon saps the health from your enemies, dealing 3d3 Constitution damage on each critical hit.

Legendary Earthgrab Guard: This item stores the implacable strength of the earth deep within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally comes to the surface, calling on the earth to erupt from the ground and hold an enemy in place.
Legendary Electric Storm: On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit this power will be released, dealing damage to the target and all enemies near it for 30d6 + 90 electric damage.

Legendary Elemental Energy: Harnessing a small amount of power and potential of the raw elements, this item gives you a +150 bonus to your maximum spell points. This stacks with all bonuses except for Legendary Elemental Energy.

Legendary Entangling Yarn: Enemies struck by this weapon have a small chance to be tangled up in its enchanted yarn, becoming Entangled and preventing all movement for 9 seconds. A DC 110 Reflex Save negates this effect.

Legendary Lightningstorm Guard: This item stores the incredible, dynamic power of the air deep within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally comes to the surface, striking the attacker with an incredible amount of electrical force.

Legendary Magma Surge Guard: This item stores the immeasurable heat of the planet's molten mantle. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, superheated magma occasionally surges to the surface, causing a tremendous amount of Fire damage to the attacker.

Legendary Nightmare Guard: On being hit or missed, this item has a chance to attempt to fear your enemy, ripping the life from them as if they were struck with a Phantasmal Killer spell. Enemies must make a DC 100 Will save versus the Fear or a DC 100 Fortitude save versus Death or be slain. Even if they make their save versus Death, they may still be feared.
Legendary Paralysis: On hit, this has a chance of paralyzing your enemies. Struck enemies must make a DC 100 Fortitude save or be paralyzed.
Legendary Sirocco: On hit, this has a chance of blinding your enemies with whirling sand. Struck enemies must make a DC 100 Fortitude save or be blinded.
Legendary Slay Living : On hit, this has a chance of snuffing the life from your foes, slaying them instantly. Struck enemies must make a DC 100 Fortitude save or be slain.

Legendary Slicing Winds: This weapon whistles with the wind. On hit, this mysterious power has a chance of coming to the surface, slicing at the struck enemy for a significant amount of Slashing damage.

Legendary Slowburst: This weapon has an image of a snail worked into its hilt or grip, and it feels cold to the touch. Whenever you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target is slowed for 30 seconds. A DC 100 Will save negates this effect.

Legendary Stealer of Souls: Blackrazor hungers for the Souls of those you have defeated. On a Vorpal hit with this weapon, Blackrazor will absorb some of its Soul, draining one level from the target. When you strike the killing blow on an enemy, Blackrazor retains one Defeated Soul, up to a maximum of 20. Each Defeated Soul grants you +1 Profane bonus to Melee Power and +1 Profane bonus to Damage. If you block or unequip Blackrazor, the Defeated Souls will be released. Defeated Souls last for 30 seconds.

Legendary Stone Guard: This item is invested with the power of the earth. On being struck in melee, it has the chance to attempt to turn the target to stone, as the Flesh to Stone spell. A successful Fortitude save (DC 100) negates the effect.

Legendary Stone Prison: This weapon is invested with the power of the earth. On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit it will attempt to turn the target to stone, as the Flesh to Stone spell. A successful Fortitude save (DC 100) negates this effect.
Legendary Tet-zik, The Enlightened Change: Whispers of the ancients grant you the ancient martial secrets of the Thri-Kreen. Your elemental Monk stances grant additional bonuses.

Legendary Trap the Soul: This equipment stores an overwhelming, merciless power deep within. When you strike an enemy with a melee or missile attack, this power occasionally comes to the surface, sucking out the life force of an enemy and imprisoning the essence of their body and soul in a gem.
Legendary Telekinetic: On hit, this has a chance of knocking your enemies off their feet. Struck enemies must make a DC 100 Reflex save or be knocked down.

Buff.Type: Legendary Vile Grip of the Hidden Hand
Buff.DisplayText: Legendary Vile Grip of the Hidden Hand: Attacks and offensive spells have a small chance to deal massive evil damage.

Legendary Virulent Poison: This item carries a potent poison that is delivered with your attacks. On any strike, the Poison has a chance to be applied, dealing 5d6 Constitution damage if your enemy fails a DC100 Fortitude saving throw.

Legendary Whelming Shockwave: This weapon reverberates with incredible power. On Vorpal, this weapon triggers a Shockwave, striking its target with incredible bludgeoning damage and dealing damage to surrounding enemies.

Lesser Aberration Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Aberrations, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +1 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 1 to 6 points of damage against the foe.
Lesser Action Boost Enhancement: This will increase the total number of Action Boosts you can use by 2. However, these additional Action Boosts will only take effect after the wielder rests.
Lesser Acid Resistance: This property absorbs the first 3 points of Acid damage per attack that the wearer would normally take.
Lesser Arcane Casting Dexterity: This ability reduces the arcane spell failure chance by -5%.

Lesser Boneshatter: This weapon is powerful enough to shatter the bones of those it strikes. On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit, the weapon breaks multiple bones in the target's body, causing significant impairment. Creatures with skeletons take 10d6 damage and will have their movement and attacks slowed by 25% and their attack damage reduced by 25% when their bones are shattered.
Lesser Cold Resistance: This property absorbs the first 3 points of cold damage per attack that the wearer would normally take.
Lesser Displacement: Equipping this item causes light to distort around you. Attacks from enemies have a 25% chance to miss you due to concealment.
Lesser Divine Augmentation IX: Increases the wearer's caster level when casting ninth level or lower Divine spells by one.

Lesser Dwarf Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Dwarves, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +1 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 1 to 6 points of damage against the foe.

Lesser Elemental Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Elementals, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +1 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 1 to 6 points of damage against the foe.
Lesser False Life: This item grants the wearer +5 maximum health.
Lesser Fire Resistance: This property absorbs the first 3 points of fire damage per attack that the wearer would normally take.

Lesser Halfling Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Halflings, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +1 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 1 to 6 points of damage against the foe.

Lesser Monstrous Humanoid Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Monstrous Humanoids, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +1 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 1 to 6 points of damage against the foe.

Lesser Incorporeal Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Incorporeals, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +1 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 1 to 6 points of damage against the foe.
Lesser Lightning Resistance: This property absorbs the first 3 points of Electric damage per attack that the wearer would normally take.
Lesser Regeneration: This item is imbued with an undeniable goodness that slowly heals the wearer over time.
Lesser Turning: Increases total number of Turn Undead uses by 2, once wielder rests. If you unequip the item you will lose these turns.

Lesser Undead Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Undead, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +1 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 1 to 6 points of damage against the foe.
Lesser Arcane Augmentation I: Increases the wearer's caster level when casting first level sorcerer or wizard spells by one.
Lesser Arcane Augmentation IX: Increases the wearer's caster level when casting ninth level or lower sorcerer or wizard spells by one.
Lesser Undead Guard: This armor burns those Undead that attack the wearer, causing 1d8 Good damage on a successful melee attack.
Lesser Vampirism: This weapon drains a tiny portion of the target's life force whenever it does damage. (Note: provides 1 hp of healing per hit.)

Life-Devouring: This weapon deprives an enemy of its energy and passes it on to you. When you roll a 20 on an attack, the enemy must make a DC 28 Fortitude save or be subjected to a -6 penalty to all stats. At the same time you will feel your power return, as though Greater Restoration were cast on you. (Greater Restoration cures all temporary ability damage, restores all negative levels suffered from energy drain, and eliminates fatigue, exhaustion, confusion, and insanity suffered by you.)

Lifedrinker: This weapon uses the power of water to draw out the life essence of its targets. On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit, this power comes to the surface, granting 25 temporary hit points to the wielder and dealing 25 to 45 damage to the target. Creatures with the Fire trait take double this damage instead.
Life Shield: Every time you are hit while wearing a Life Shield item there is a 10% chance you gain 15 temporary hitpoints that last for up to 1 minute.
Life Stealing: This weapon has a chance to drain 1 to 3 levels from its target on a critical hit.
%b1 Lifesealed %v1: You are immune to magical effects that cause instant death. In addition, you have a %v1 %b1 bonus to Negative Energy Absorption.
Light Bringer: On Vorpal Hit: If an undead struck by this weapon has fewer than 1000 Hit Points, it is instantly slain. If the undead has above 1000 hit points, it takes 100 damage.
%b1 Lightning Lore %v1%: Passive: Your Electric spells gain a %v1% %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.

Lightning Storm Guard: This item stores the power of a volatile thunderstorm deep within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this dynamic power occasionally comes to the surface, devastating enemies with a massive lightning strike.
Lightning Strike: This weapon stores the power of a volatile thunderstorm deep within. Occasionally, this dynamic power comes to the surface, devastating enemies with a massive lightning strike.

Maiming: This weapon has a twisted haft or grip and spikes along its blade, head, or point. Whenever you score a critical hit with this weapon it deals an amount of extra untyped damage depending on its critical multiplier: x2 - 1 to 6, x3 - 2 to 12, x4 - 3 to 18.
Maiming 2: This weapon has a twisted haft or grip and spikes along its blade, head, or point. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, it does an additional +2d8 damage.
Maiming 3: This weapon has a twisted haft or grip and spikes along its blade, head, or point. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, it does an additional +3d8 damage.
Maiming 4: This weapon has a twisted haft or grip and spikes along its blade, head, or point. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, it does an additional +4d8 damage.
Maiming 5: This weapon has a twisted haft or grip and spikes along its blade, head, or point. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, it does an additional +5d8 damage.
Maiming 6: This weapon has a twisted haft or grip and spikes along its blade, head, or point. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, it does an additional +6d8 damage.
Maker's Touch: Casting a Repair spell on yourself or allies leaves a lingering defensive buff that increases the AC and Physical Resistance Rating of your target by +3 for 12 seconds.

Malleable : This item has a magical aura of malleability and can be combined with any item that has the Fusible property to create a new, more powerful fusion of the two items. (DDOBuilder Note: The Malleable versions of these items are separate items)

Manslayer: While wearing this item, your weapon attacks gain the devastating ability to defeat a humanoid opponent with a single decisive blow. On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit a humanoid target will be killed. Powerful humanoids may resist the vorpal strike and instead take 100 points of damage until they have been sufficiently weakened.
Marksmanship: This item is enchanted to enhance your skill with ranged weapons. When using ranged weapons you gain +2 to your attack rolls and +1 to your damage.
Masterwork: This armor is more finely crafted than normal, reducing the Armor Check Penalty by 1.
Masterwork: This weapon is more finely crafted than normal, providing a +1 Enhancement bonus on attack rolls.
Maximum Charge Tier I: The maximum charge tier of this rune arm is tier 1.
Maximum Charge Tier II: The maximum charge tier of this rune arm is tier 2.

Maximum Charge Tier IV: The maximum charge tier of this rune arm is tier 4.
Maximum Charge Tier V: The maximum charge tier of this rune arm is tier 5.
