Medusa Fury: When you fall below 25% of your maximum hit points you will enter a constant Medusa Fury until your hit points return to 25% or greater. Medusa Fury grants a +4 morale bonus to Strength and Constitution, a 5% morale bonus to your chance to doublestrike, and a -25% penalty to fortifications.
%b1 Melee Power %v1: This item provides a %v1 %b1 bonus to Melee Power.
Metal Fatigue: The metal plates of this armor sometimes tire you out. When you are damaged there is a small chance that you will become Exhausted.
Metalline: Metalline bypasses any metal based damage reduction. (Adamantine, "Alchemical, Silver", Byeshk, Cold Iron, Mithral)
Mind Drain: This item reduces your maximum spell points by 5% while equipped.
Minor Action Boost Enhancement: This will increase the total number of Action Boosts you can use by 1. However, these additional Action Boosts will only take effect after the wielder rests.

Minor Lesser Dragonmark Enhancement: This will increase the total number of Lesser Dragonmarks you can use by 1. However, these additional Lesser Dragonmarks will only take effect after the wielder rests.
Minor Spell Penetration VII: Your Level 7 and lower spells gain +1 to the die roll to penetrate the target's Spell Resistance.
Mortal Strike: On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit this weapon triggers the Slay Living spell and attempts to instantly snuff out the life force of the enemy (DC 17).
Mithral: Mithral armor is one type lighter then normal. Arcane Spell Failure decreased by 10%. Maximum dexterity bonus increased by 2. Armor check penalty reduced by 3.
Mother Night's Embrace: This weapon is unholy and imbued by one of the two deities of Barovia - the Mother Night. This weapon is evil, dealing an additional 3d6 evil damage on hit.
Monstrous Humanoid Bane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt those who are descended from monsters dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Monstrous Humanoids.
Monstrous Humanoid Bane 3: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt those who are descended from monsters dealing an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Monstrous Humanoids.

Negative Energy Spike: This weapon is pulsating with negative energy. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of negative energy damage on a successful hit.

Nightmare Guard: This item has a chance to terrorizing foes that hit you, applying a Mind Thrust effect, when you are hit by them (dealing 5d8 force damage, Will save vs. Enchantments negates). It may also expose your foes to their greatest fears, acting as a Phantasmal Killer spell.

Nightmares: This weapon terrorizes your foes, applying a Mind Thrust effect on successful hits (dealing 5 to 40 force damage, Will vs. Enchantments negates) and exposing your foes to their greatest fears on vorpal hits, acting as a Phantasmal Killer spell.

Nightshade Venom: Any creature struck by this weapon must succeed on a Difficulty Check 22 Fortitude save or fall unconscious. The target may attempt a new save to end the effect every several seconds; otherwise the sleep lasts for 20 seconds.
Nightsinger: 5% Chance On Sonic Spell Hit: Target is Blinded for 6 Seconds

Occultation: 20% Enhancement bonus to Decreased threat generated from all damage.
On Critical Hit: 1d4 Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution Damage.

Ooze Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Oozes, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.
Ooze Bane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt Oozes, dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Oozes.
Ooze Bane 5: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt Oozes, dealing an additional 5d10 bane damage vs. Oozes.
Overfocus: This item helps you focus your attention, but it makes you somewhat oblivious to your surroundings, causing a -10 penalty to Search and Spot .
Overwhelming Incineration: This weapon stores the power of a raging inferno deep within. Occasionally, this destructive power comes to the surface, devastating enemies with overwhelming fire damage.

Overwhelming Shockwave: This legendary weapon resonates with incredible power. On a Vorpal strike that is confirmed as a critical hit, it releases a Shockwave that does tremendous Sonic damage to all foes. Furthermore, the enemy that the shockwave is released on is Dazed from the force of the blast.

Overwhelming Stealer of Souls: This weapon tears at the very essence of your foes. On any strike, this weapon applies a single stack of Soul Scar, which reduces your target's Will Saves, Armor Class, and Fortification by 1 per stack, max 10. Occasionally, this weapon attempts to rip the life from your foe, as if it were the victim of a Phantasmal Killer spell with a DC of 100 versus Will. Bosses (and enemies with more than 10,000 hit points) are immune to this effect. Killing a monster will consume your soul, adding a stack of Consumed Soul to you. Consumed Souls stack up to 20 times, and linger for 20 seconds. Each one provides a +1 Profane bonus to Damage and Melee Power . If you block or unequip this weapon, the Consumed Souls will be released.
Paragon Cerulean Wave: This powerful magical implement hums in your hands and resonates with icy magic. Spells you cast have a chance of freezing your targets in a block of solid ice. DC: 100

Paragon Good Guard: When hit or missed in combat, the attacking creature takes 4d8 Good damage.
Paragon Light Guard: When hit or missed in combat, the attacking creature takes 4d8 Light damage.
Paragon Negative Guard: When hit or missed in combat, the attacking creature takes 4d8 Negative damage.

Any creature struck by this weapon must succeed on a DC 17 Will save or be paralyzed. The target may attempt a new save to end the effect every several seconds; otherwise the paralysis lasts for 1 minute. Certain creatures, such as the Undead and Constructs, cannot be paralyzed.

%b1 Proof Against Disease %v1: This item grants its wearer immunity to natural diseases. This item also grants a %v1 %b1 bonus to saving throws against magical diseases, and the wearer does not fail saving throws against them on a roll of a natural 1 (this renders the wearer immune to magical diseases with a DC of less than 3 + their Fortitude save).

%b1 Proof Against Poison %v1: This item grants its wearer immunity to natural poisons. This item also grants a %v1 %b1 bonus to saving throws against magical poisons, and the wearer does not fail saving throws against them on a roll of a natural 1 (this renders the wearer immune to magical poisons with a DC of less than 11 + their Fortitude save).

Power Store: This item collects and stores magical energy. Any spell caster can use this energy to partially power their spells. All spells cast while using this item receive an enhancement bonus of -10% to their spell point costs.

In addition, critical hits deal an additional 1 to 8 damage for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 2 to 16 for a x3 critical multiplier and 3 to 24 for a x4 multiplier. Creatures with the Fire trait take double this damage instead.
Tira's Splendor: Any weapon you wield becomes able to bypass silver damage reduction.
Trace of Madness: You can almost hear faint, panicked voices when this item is close to you. Perhaps the latent power of this item's hint of madness could be brought out by some catalyst.
Transform Kinetic Energy: Each time you are hit in melee combat there is a chance that the energy of the blow will be converted into Spell Points.

Transmuted Platinum: This weapon, made of transmuted platinum, is slightly magically unstable, and has a chance to transfer its magic to those it strikes. Struck enemies have a small chance to turn into transmuted platinum, preventing all movement, with a DC of 35 negating this effect.
Treason: This item reduces the threat generated by melee damage by 20%.
True Chaos: This weapon is infused with the power of True Chaos. It does an additional 1 to 6 damage to non-chaotic targets and can only be wielded by Chaotic-aligned characters.
True Law: This weapon is infused with the power of True Law. It does an additional 1 to 6 damage to non-lawful targets and can only be wielded by Lawful-aligned characters.
True Seeing: Passive: You gain the benefit of the spell True Seeing.
Turning: This will increase the total number of Turn Undead attempts you can use by 3. However, these additional Turn Undead attempts will only take effect after the wielder rests.
Twilight: This suit of armor, favored by Eladrin spell casters, becomes semi-incorporeal when donned. The twilight armor reduces the chance of arcane spell failure by -10%.
Twining Hemlock: This weapon is poisoned with a deadly strain of flowering plant. Hits by this weapon have a chance of putting your foe to sleep.

Underwater Action: This item grants the wearer the ability to breathe water as if it were air.

Combine this item in Visbane's Folly atop Sentinel's Tower in House Deneith Enclave with a Sigil of the Goat, a Sigil of the Lion, and a Sigil of the Dragon to restore its original enchantments.
Unwieldy: This weapon is very large and makes you clumsier as you wield it, causing a -2 Dexterity penalty.

Vengeful Fury: On Taking Damage: Gain a 12% Enhancement Bonus to Doublestrike and a +4 Rage Bonus to your Attack Bonus.

Vorpal: Passive: +0.5[W] damage dice. On Vorpal Hit: If your target has fewer than 1000 Hit Points, they are instantly slain. If your target has above 1000 Hit Points, they take 100 damage.
On Vorpal: Applies a stack of Lethargy (-1 to all Saving Throws. Non-bosses also move and attack 5% slower. This effect stacks up to 5 times.)
Vulnerable: You take 1% more damage for 3 seconds. This effect stacks up to 20 times, and loses one stack on expiration.
Wailing: Shrieking weapons emit a haunting wail whenever they are used to make a successful attack. This wail deals an additional 3 to 18 sonic damage.
